definitions.definition: Visual perception . ( obsolete ) Appearance; show; aspect.
examples: That video got a million views .

subdefinitions.definition: The act of seeing or looking at something.
examples: He changed seats to get a complete view of the stage.
If there are any rabbits in this park, they keep carefully out of our view .

subdefinitions.definition: Something to look at, such as scenery .
examples: My flat has a view of a junkyard.

subdefinitions.definition: An individual viewing of a web page or a video etc. by a user.

definitions.definition: A picture , drawn or painted; a sketch .
examples: a fine view of Lake George

definitions.definition: An opinion , judgement , imagination , idea or belief .

examples: I need more information to get a better view of the situation.

subdefinitions.definition: A way of understanding something, an opinion , a theory .
examples: Your view on evolution is based on religious doctrines, not on scientific findings.
From my view that is a stupid proposition.
He smuggled a knife into prison with a view to using it as a weapon.

definitions.definition: A virtual or logical table composed of the result set of a query in relational databases .
The part of a computer program which is visible to the user and can be interacted with
A wake . (Can we add an example for this sense?)

main_definition: ( physical ) Visual perception . ( obsolete ) Appearance; show; aspect.
secondary_definitions: A picture , drawn or painted; a sketch .
An opinion , judgement , imagination , idea or belief .
( computing , databases ) A virtual or logical table composed of the result set of a query in relational databases .
( computing , programming ) The part of a computer program which is visible to the user and can be interacted with
A wake . (Can we add an example for this sense?)
